communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Israel/Palestine emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all emails containing the non-case-sensitive keystrings "Israel," "Palestine," "Palestinian," "Hamas," and/or "Jerusalem" sent to or from one or more of the following Clifton Police Department officials between October 7, 2023 and the date this request is processed:
- Captain Darren Kester
- Captain Christopher Stabile
- Detective Lt. Robert Bracken
- Detective Lt. William Frank
- Lt. Mohammand Droubi
- Detective Lt. Maurice Scardigno
- Captain Tom Rinaldi

If any of the emails contain attachments, please include those attachments as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: NJ Governor FOIA Request Log for 2022 and 2023

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: NJ Governor FOIA Request Log for 2022 and 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Act requests made with the governor's office for calendar years 2022 and 2023. I ask that all fields — including the date, requester, description and disposition — are included.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: First 10 emails and texts sent by L.A. Mayor Karen Bass

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: First 10 emails and texts sent by L.A. Mayor Karen Bass
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The first ten emails sent by L.A. Mayor Karen Bass in her official email account after talking office, excluding all meeting invitations. I ask only for email *messages* sent and received

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh
